these work great even though i do not have an iphone, i use them with my android phone and i was worried about compatibility issues but gratefully i did not come across any. i got them over the other in-ear headphones because my ear starts to ache if something is inside it too long. these are perfect as they stay just near the outer part allowing my inner ear to get some breathing space. sound quality is great as expected from the brand however the noise cancelling could be better. but that's a price to pay for my ear to not be fully closed off. a lot of the advertised features don't work because i'm not using an iphone (such as siri, ear detection or even battery detection - which can be frustrating). but here are some features that did work:- you cannot double tap to get to siri (or google) but the double tap instead works to pause or play the media!- you can still use just one earphone since they both connect differently. (will need to change settings to allow for mono audio, this can be found in accessibility).

i give these airpods a 5/5 stars because they are excellent :) they have a very long battery life and they are actually noise canceling, even with one airpod in your ear. i had airpod pros before i brought these but lost them back in february, and i actually like these better than the pros because they don’t feel heavy in your ear. airpod pros are smaller than these, so they’re more likely to fall out your ear. with these, they stay in your ear without feeling so heavy, and won’t have to worry about them falling out! only downside i have about these airpods are that after about 2 months, my left airpod sounded a little low. but that’s nothing a little setting adjusting won’t fix :) overall these are excellent headphones!

in the 80's i thought apple's computers were novel. since then i avoid apple products for the most part (long story). i recognize their innovation. i purchased a pair of apple's $15 wired pods for the gym, primarily because they were inexpensive. i was impressed with the sound for such an inexpensive price, but the wire from the pods just got in the way at the gym. prior to this purchase i bought another pair of buds, i was sadly disappointed. i figured i'd give the apple pods a try kind of expecting the same sound quality as the wired pods, but wireless. wow, these are so much better, the bass is warm, the mid and highs are crisp but not harsh or fatiguing, these are amazingly good. still not an apple fan, but i do give credit where credit is due. i'd buy these again.

they sound great, are easy to charge and store, the batteries last a very long time, and the noise canceling feature works very well. they are really easy to connect to any device too. but they have a tendency to fall out of my ear, and that costs them a star. maybe it is just my particular ears, but almost every time i use them, one manages to fall out and hit the ground at some point. because of that, i have to be careful where i use them. motorcycle rides and river activities are out of the question. once one fell out while i was on the riding mower, and it took me about ten very stressful minutes to find it. i have since learned that it helps to wrap a bandanna around my head and ears when mowing. unfortunately this isn't a perfect solution either, as the other day one still managed to fall out and hit the ground when mowing. fortunately i found it right away that time.thank goodness they certainly do seem to be very durable. my kid's airpod pros got washed and dried, and they still worked! i heard them clanking around in the drier for 30 minutes, but thought it was just a nickel or something.anyway, for around the house or office they are great. but don't think you can trust them to go anywhere.

here’s a pros and cons list;pros* answering calls and texts hands free is nice. as someone who works full time and always has full hands, this is really nice.* they’re small and there are no wires, so i don’t have to untangle or worry about wires getting messed up when i put these in my bag. i can also put them in my pocket.* the charging case is convenient. i like only having to charge the case every three or four days, and always having it on me in case my earbuds get low.cons* they don’t fit in my ears. they constantly fall out, so i’m always readjusting. if i walk at a fast pace, it seems to speed up the process.* they’re not noise cancelling.* the sound quality is a bit weak. i have 8 dollar headphones that are better with sound quality.* they cut out sometimes for no reason and i can’t figure out why.* they aren’t very loud.i think that for $100, these could be much better.

i had recently purchased the apple airpods 2nd generation, and while i am happy with my purchase, there are some elements of the design, function and use that bother me, needless to say i feel happy with my purchase. as this generation is not the newest, some of my complaints have been addressed through the new release of the next generation of apple airpods, however, that brings me to my first issue, cost. the price of these earphones, even being “out of date” is still significantly higher than competitors with a range of 80 - 130 usd.  furthermore, with the design of the airpods, and the hard shell they come in, after using the product for a significant amount of time, they start to hurt your ears and make them sore. this is counterproductive from their main function and design, with their wireless capabilities and small design meant to not only fit snugly, but be able to be forgotten about. with the amount of substitute goods on the market, there are clearly a wide range of options to choose from. so why did i choose to buy the apple airpods?when this product first came out, the high price and novelty was somewhat justified, as this was a big step in change for apple, as well, they had just gotten rid of their headphone jack in their phones, almost forcing people to switch over to different headphones. as well the sound quality was incredibly clear and the airpods allowed you to wear them for hours on end with just one charge. one of the biggest things i love about the airpods is how easy it is to transfer them, there are no cords to get tangled and they come in a small case. what really convinced me to invest in these earphones though was a friend of mine, sarah, when she explained how she loved to go on walks and runs with them, and they don’t fall out and make for a very fun experience. she encouraged me to get the airpods because they are a great benefit “not only for your class, but also just for your every day life”. i am not the biggest runner but i do love to go on outdoor hikes with my dog, and so after hearing her review i went out to go purchase a pair.
easy to use

i recently bought these last month and after a month of usage i find this product to be very well designed. but i think personally there are still some design flaws.1. you can't wear it very long- after a certain point maybe after 2 hours, you ears start to hurt especially if your playing loud music or something.-the battery on these earphones aren't the best either 4 hours are the longest they've ever lasted after a full night's charge too 100%2. this is not an honest product- i live in new york city, a very loud place, so when i see noise canceling, i want to be able to not hear the noises on the train on my commutes to work, school and home. so in terms of noise canceling, i don't think this product is very honest.but otherwise the product is great, the sound quality is great (unless your on a call at the same time), the case doesn't need to be charged to often, it's very good if you need a quality wireless earphone.

i use these with my new ipad, my dell inspiron 13 laptop, and my samsung galaxy s8 phone. they pretty much always stay in my ears unless i really shake them out. they have pretty good sound quality, though i'm not much of a sound buff. sometimes though when i'm using my phone the airpods disconnect from each other creating a double echo sound, which is really uncomfortable for me - i have to disconnect the airpods and reconnect them to fix it. i'm someone who needs to have a constant stream of music in my ears, so this has been a godsend because it's so easy to do chores while having them in. i've never been able to mess with volume with just the airpods, and i can't pause/unpause with just the airpods on non-apple devices. but i can skip to the next song on my phone by tapping the right airpod twice. i've dropped them and had them go flying out of the case at least ten times but they're still fine.

my wife has small ear canals, and cannot fit the ear buds that work for me. she hadn't found any of the ones with silicone tips that would fit comfortably. these second generation airpods fit perfectly, paired with her various devices quickly and easily, and even have respectable sound quality. she loves them and uses them all the time. i was glad we were finally able to get some buds that she would use!

i wanted to try some of these and when they had a good price here on amazon i went ahead and purchased a pair  i wasn't prepared to pay the price for the newest version. i also have a set of beats earbuds which are very nice and probably fit my ear a bit better but that's mainly because they sort of twist into your ear. these being a different thing altogether, where they slide into your ear and hang there is nice because they don't pop out, on the other hand the sound quality is going to work better if they fit tightly in your ear versus loosely so a lot of that's is going to depend on the individual. they have fine audio reproduction but as you might expect with such small speakers the base is a bit light and the noise cancellation seems to work but it's only going to work if there's a good seal around the earbud and the ear itself so once again that's going to depend on your ear. they are slightly larger than some but i didn't find that to be a problem. they  work well in a work out, mainly because if you're going to use earbuds and are using ones that fit tightly into your ear, like beats, they're more likely to work their way out during your exercise program as you move your head and so forth. if they seem a good price you can't go wrong

i bought these for multiple uses: music, podcasts, conference calls and watching training and youtube videos.  i’m sure someone who is knowledgeable in audio products could better vouch for the sound quality of these versus the newer versions, i’m just an everyday guy and these work perfectly for all the uses i’ve mentioned.i’m an apple ecosystem guy, and the seamless and instant pairing and compatibility were the main reason i got these instead of knock offs.  i’ve tried the cheap route before and from intermittent pairing/dropping, to being completely unable to use with multiple devices, and these were worth the extra money to avoid that.they average about 2-4 hours of use per charge, and with the quick recharge of the case i’ve never had to worry about dead earphones.  i love these, the newer versions might be technically better, but for the value i don’t think you can beat these.

airpods second generation is wireless bluetooth earbuds designed by apple inc. they are white wireless earbuds that come inside a case that uses bluetooth from your phone. you can watch videos, listen to music, or even hear anything that comes from your phone. they know when they're inserted in your ear and are ready to work as soon as you put them in, and additionally, they'll pause audio automatically when you remove them. the product is really easy to use. all you have to do is put them in your ear, go to your setting and connect them to your phone, and play whatever you like from your phone.  i have had this product for 2 years now and i still love them even though they come out with new ones almost every year or 2. my experience with airpods has been great. i haven't ever had a problem with my airpods. i feel like the second generation is enough for me because all the generations work the same, they just get better and louder, and since i have had them for so long i think it's time for me to upgrade and get new ones. everybody i know uses this product, and they love them. airpods are really popular in the teenage world, almost every teenager has a pair of airpods, and loves them.  air pods sound fantastic for their size, and the battery life for the airpods alone are great for their size, the charging case battery life is actually 10 times better than the airpods battery life to me the charging case stays charged longer than the actual airpods. airpods have an amazing microphone, you can talk to siri through airpods, and make phone calls, and have amazing sound. they don't only connect from your iphone but they can connect from your ipad, or apple watch as well, which is great for when you don't have your phone but still want to listen to music.  there are not many cons with airpods, but there are a few. air pods are really tiny, but that doesn't affect the sound in any way, it only affects if it will stay in your ear for so long, or if they don't fit your ears at all, because a lot of people tend to have a problem with them not fitting in everyone's ears, and since they are so tiny, it is really easy for them to get lost or misplaced definitely if they fall out of your ear and you don't even notice that they have fallen out. they are also easy to get misplaced if you don't put them back into the case right away after using them. all apple products are pretty much waterproof, but i feel like this is the only product that is not waterproof, and if they keep improving and making better ones they should all be waterproof. airpods are not good for athletes, or for people who just like to work out because if you are doing a lot of moving with these airpods in your ear 9 times out of 10 they will fall out.  i highly recommend someone to buy airpods. they are good for everyone. if you are just chilling, or just love music, or want to talk on the phone they are really convenient to people who don't like holding their phones up to their ear when they talk. as i said before, everyone i know around me has airpods and they are definitely great for teenagers. they will be a wonderful gift for someone, they are worth the price because the sound is amazing and they close out everything else around you.

i was reluctant to spend this much on a non-necessity for myself but i am so glad that i did. i listen to podcasts all day at work and only wear one headphone so i am still able to communicate. i am on my feet all day running around. i used to wear corded headphones and would snag the cord if it was popping out of my shirt and it would rip the bud out of my ear and i would go through sets quickly.now that i have these i am able to leave one in the case and switch them out as one dies so there is always one charged. the charge lasts about 6 hours  per bud and between the buds and the case, i am only plugging them in to charge about every 4 days. with these i am able to set up a queue of my podcasts and keep my phone in my desk all day. i have the double tap feature set up to pause on both so i can easily stop my podcasts to have a conversation. i love not having my phone on me or cords hanging from me. they sound great and i can’t think of a single issue i’ve had with them over the past 6 or so months. maybe there are more affordable versions but so far i am loving these. i would highly recommend them and can’t imagine how the newer/more expensive versions could be any better :)

i waited a long, long time before buying “apple” ear pods. i have used skull candy, soundpeats, and a host of others. they all have their little quirks and variations. the apple ones do as well, but not nearly as many. overall, the quality of these is awesome. the sound is great, it allows for pass through sound so i can listen to music and still hear what’s going on around me, and the charge lasts for several hours.the downside(s). first, my ears don’t necessarily fit these (or the wired ones that always came with the iphones), so i have to adjust and push these in every once in a while. i know that’s why they came out with the pro ones with the plastic ear bud. those will be the next pair i get. secondly, live listen works great, with one caveat. i would have imagined that the mic used would have been the mics on the ear buds themselves. nope. it uses your phone mic. so, if you put your phone in your pocket and have live listen on, you hear the phone shuffling around in your pocket. in other words, you have to leave your phone out (laying on your desk, holding it in your hand, etc.) in order to use it with any success. maybe that changes on other models, but for these, it makes the live listen almost pointless. i want to be hands free, with my phone in my pocket, but be able to hear someone if they talk to me. not sure what else the concept would have been used for in using the phone mic.other than those issues, i really have no complaints. the case charges the pods quickly and multiple times, so you can continue to use them for a long time. again, sound quality is as good, if not better, than any other ear buds i’ve used. you can set what the functions are, so tapping the right ear twice can mean whatever you want versus tapping the left ear twice.i am really pleased with these and would recommend them.

i'm furious. i don't buy apple products. the last one i bought was a 2nd gen ipod. i gave in and bought these after trying many many many earbuds, from all across the price spectrum, and none of them worked for me. which is why i'm furious to know that these were out there the whole time, and only my hatred of apple products kept me from enjoying them.obviously there's no noise cancelation, but the fact that i can wear them for hours comfortably is fricking amazing. i'm a side sleeper and fell asleep with them in!i had recently tried the samsung live buds and the sony link buds, both hurt my ears so badly i had to return them. went with the 2nd gen over 3rd or pro because it seemed others with small ears like mine agreed this was the best fit, and i couldn't agree more.only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is apple's obnoxious desire to make you buy into their proprietary system. i have an android and a pc and neither are changing anytime soon, which means a lot of the features that would make them a 5 star buy are not available to me.

ah yes, the 2nd generation airpods from apple that we've all been eyeing now. i'll keep it short - it plays sound quite nicely, with sufficient bass and crystal clear sound from all octaves and ranges. the sound quality and everything is practically perfect. it pairs effortlessly with any compatible apple device (i have an iphone) and it pairs almost before i put it in my ears. never knew not going to the bluetooth settings would be such a much-needed life-changing convenience.the only complaint is the noise cancellation. it does not have any whatsoever. do not even think there will be 'a little', because there is absolutely none. if you're in a loud environment and you're struggling to hear your music, your only real solution is to either find a quieter place or turn up the volume and hope you don't go deaf. if there was noise cancellation (airpods pro has them now), then it would be a perfect product. it is a minor inconvenience that makes it feel not worth the price. to people who think it may not be a problem, then this is the product for you. otherwise, go bump your purchase to the pros.

i traded my 3rd gen for these and i couldn’t be happier. 3rd gen has a weird design that made for a poor in-ear headphones experience - they would fall out all the time. i opted for these 2nd gen ones and i’m so happy. the fit is perfect and the sound is amazing. the batter life is decent but could be better. i spend hours on the phone so they constantly run out, including the charging case. but they charge incredibly fast. i love that these aren’t noise-canceling as most headphones on the market. plus it works perfectly with my iphone and macbook. one of my best and most clutch purchases.

i have tried (and still use) the entire family of airpods.  they all have their perks.  these airpods (g2) are compact, and reasonable with decent sound quality.  the g3's are a just bit better, in my opinion, but i found out the hard way that long listening sessions (like all day, in a zoom meeting) left my ears feeling a bit sore due to the new shape, whereas the g2 don't do that, at all.the ap pros have the best sound, hands down. however, after awhile, i can't tolerate the feeling of the insert in my ear, so i can only listen for an hour or so, then i need to rest my ears.so, when you break it down, there is simply a compromise of sound quality vs. ear comfort.  so, for me, for long listening sessions, phone calls, audio books, virtual meetings, audio privacy whilst you listen to videos and whatnot, etc. the gen2 are my favorite. they are also the most pocketable, and for the current price, the g2 are tough to say no to.

these are of course great.  apple isn't cheap, but they do make good products.  my wife does not tolerate any technology that is the least bit flaky or inconsistent, etc.  she hates when her iphone does one thing one time, and another thing the next time.  i figure she's probably not quite doing the same way both times, but from her point of view, it is the phone's fault, and i know better than to intervene (i am an it professional and i support over 100 iphones, but not her iphone too much - lol).these airpods have been good from day one, and much to my liking, she absolutely uses them all the time.  i would have hated to have spent that much money for these to sit in a drawer.her long dog walks (and her own exercise walks) is when she likes to talk to her daughter or her sister, and these have made her life easier for sure.  iphone in back pocket, dog leash in hand, no issues with volume or clarity - awesome.

i’ve had several pairs of airpods. these are my favorite. i’m comparing them to the first gen, obvious these are an upgrade. also, i’ve had the pros, did not like them as they fell out of my ear all the time, even with differing sized ear inserts. i own the airpod 3 too- same problem of them falling out.the 2’s are a perfect fit for my ear as well and the pro and 3’s are painful after about 45 minutes. the controls are superior in my opinion. tap, double tap- excellent idea and works great. the squeeze on the pro and 3, odd decision practicality-wise as you have to squeeze a specific part of the airpods which can and does cause it to loosen in your ear and more easily fall out. not sure why apple did that or continues to.only thing these don’t have is noise canceling. doesn’t bother me though, i don’t like/need that feature. i hope they keep making the 2nd gen, i’ll keep buying them. best on the market at the moment.

these headphones are perfect for daily use. the charge time is fantastic as well as the over all life of the headsets. the sound quality is as expected, they have good low end for that they are, the mid’s are clear and high end is bright. as these are not a completely enclosed ear bud they do have a little ambient back ground bleeding. this small amount of extra noise isn’t a problem. i use these ear buds when i ride my motorcycle under my helmet. i have no problems with to much wind noice or other sounds blocking out what i’m trying to listen to. i find it’s nice to have some noice reduction with out being completely blocked off from my surroundings. i’ve had no issues with them falling out of my ears or being bumped out of place.

i was disappointed when apple "forgot" the earbud jacks on new iphones, forcing me to buy a more expensive alternative.  but actually, those corded earbuds hurt if they accidentally got yanked out of your ears.i'm impressed with the sound - much better than my old corded earbuds.i'm impressed with the battery life, but how do you charge them in use? - if you anticipate running low when you're on hold for hours with your cable service, you can put one in its charging case and use the other by itself, then later swap them.the charging case has a magnet to suck them down solidly on the electrical contacts and prevent them from spilling out accidentally, but it makes them awkward to retrieve from the case with big fingers.they practically bluetooth-synced with my iphone all by themselves.  and when you open the case near the iphone, the iphone tells your the battery level of both the earbuds and the case.i just wish they came in other colors, like black to match my iphone.

update: i exchanged the defective first pair for a new pair. the new pair paired with my phone quickly, and actually they have really good sound. they work well with my iphone and if i have my ipad nearby they will pair to that easily.they seem to stay in my ear well, the sound is crisp and clear and the bass is even decent. i wanted an option to have earbuds that didn’t totally block out the outside world that way people won’t yell at me at home and i won’t hear them.this type of earbud that is ‘not isolating’ actually is easier to use for dictation and phone calls. the ones that seal tight in your ears are muddy and have skull resonance that makes it hard to make phone calls.i am not sure of the long-term durability yet, and i am really considering buying the applecare protection just in case this new pair has problems. i am upping the review to five stars.original review: only two stars.now that the price has come down, i decided to try a set of these 2nd gen. airpods. i got an authentic, new pair, they have nice finish and feel, and the pairing details shows i can buy the applecare extended warranty, so i don't believe they are fake.i followed the setup instructions, but it only paired one earbud. the other was staticky and then had no audio. when i took out one earpod and put the other in, waited couple seconds, that one has audio. then when put the second one in, there is only stereo audio for perhaps 5-8 seconds, then one ear gets staticky or drops signal, then just one earpod.i spent the next 30 or 45 minutes (or maybe an hour) 'forgetting' the earpods, resetting the case, re-pairing them, it has the same problems. i have multiple other bluetooth earbuds, headphones, etc., and have not had problems like this. i followed the instructions from apple to the letter, and searched other websites for ideas.they just will not play both earbuds at the same time. the signal also loses connection and has signal interruptions, static, loss.when they do play together, the sound is very good to me, clear, with some bass, and they fit in my ears well. i wanted to try a pair of these so that i can hear ambient noise around me and people, other kinds i have seal tight and you can't hear anything around you (and also phone calls are harder to make since you can't hear your own voice as well.)i am going to order another set and see if that one will work properly. for $110, and the $30 extra, these airpods should work perfectly and without all these issues.i have, for instance, 4 other sets of taotronics earbuds and they work flawlessly and easily, and they were only $40 each. the apple earbuds are triple that cost and can't do a basic pairing to my iphone 13.if the second set doesn't work correctly, i'll just pass and go with a different company.

i wear them to work everyday, i have smaller ears and these (the second gen) are more comfortable than the airpod 3rd generation, because apple redesigned the shape. so these fit great. i like these more than the 3rd also because you get more flexibility with the stem whether you want to program siri or skip to next track/pause/play. with the 3rd apple has it preset and can’t be change. plus the second generation version is cheaper. highly recommended !!!

one day, i was at the poolside listening to music with these airpods. it was 80°, not a single cloud in the sky. i enjoyed the heat, but decided to jump into the pool to cool off. as i’m completely submerged in water, i realized my music was still playing in my ears… underwater. of course, the longer i stayed under water, i realized that the audio was cutting out. so then i frantically get them out onto the side of the pool away from the water. i dried it off with a towel, and let it sit for a little bit. then, i got onto my golf cart to go back home and popped my airpods back in. both airpods survived the water. i lived happily ever after.thanks

these (2nd generation) airpods are amazing! they offer hours of fantastic sound and are a great way to listen to music and jump on a call anytime. the battery life is pretty solid, giving five hours of listen and talk time. when you place them into the case, they will automatically charge very fast allowing up to 24 hours of listening time without having to plug them in. the only downside is the terrible noise cancellation. it does not offer it as a feature in the product however the lack of noise cancellation is very noticeable. i have also had some issues connecting back to my phone each time but it is very easy to reconnect, so it's not much of a problem. overall, i would say this is a great product and would highly recommend it.

i’m sure some of these good and bad reviews are fake. i’m a real account giving a real reviewer as a regular amazon shopper. i am no paid reviewer and i’m someone who prides myself on helping others receive the best clarity possible when it comes to you all spending your money so i have your back. have no fear. a real reviewer is here! loli purchased 2nd generation airpods a year ago in atlanta from best buy. i lost them. i was skeptical purchasing through amazon when it comes to airpods but they are a third party seller, just like best buy of course so it’s no difference. honest review =  i saw 400,000 good reviews and a few thousand that were in the bad. the good outweighed the bad. i purchased the $29 warranty because, why not? i didn’t before - and lost them lol so i’m not making that mistake again.i just received them. pretty quickly too. overnight. received by 8-9am the next morning.the sound quality, the charger, the case, = so far everything’s really good. ! i am pleased with my purchase. one of my favorite features is even when i’m not near my phone, but i have the airpods in - it’ll ask me to read my message through my ear and i can also reply. which comes in handy. it’s very clear and loud.if anything changes? i’ll return to edit but if you don’t see an edit? it’s no issue. purchase them. as far as android users? come on. let’s use our basic common sense here. these are apple product airpods for apple products. of course you’re going to have certain issues for your device when it’s by samsung ok? lol i see most of the bad reviews were android users so i was utterly perplexed.jamming out to my airpods as i prepare to do my dishes. do it. i’m the angel in your ear saying do it, but it. to the android users, babes don’t buy it lol love you all have a blessed day and be kind to others. law of attraction guys, is absolutely real. trust so be kind today! muah

this is the second time i’ve bought these air pods. i love them! very good quality and comfortable. they fit my ears very well snd don’t fall out. the price was also very reasonable for the quality. it came in nice sealed box and brand new. the battery lasts really long on the case. i don’t charge it every day. depends on how much i use them but can generally go a few days without charging case. when wearing these i can pretty much hear when someone talks to me yet they are good enough that i can hear what i’m listening even if someone in room is watching tv. to me i would not want 100% noise cancelling because that doesn’t seem safe to me. i like that i can control them on the pod itself or my phone. i’m very pleased with my purchase and would buy them a third time if needed. i feel no need to buy newer air pods with very little features i don’t get with these. i recommend to my brother and he bought some fir himself and our mother and they love them as well. my son also has them and is very happy with them. highly recommend these! the price is half what the newest air pods are but the quality is not. excellent quality and price.

these wireless earbuds are amazing. they have a smooth connection to your phone and the possibilities of what they can assist you in, in your everyday life to make things easier are endless. they make listening to music, podcasts, phone calls, and talking to siri almost effortless. the 2nd generation apple airpods automatically connect to your phone through bluetooth first thing when you open the wireless charging case. the wireless charging case charges your airpods just by inserting them into their spots and closing the case. by charging your airpods in the case for just fifteen minutes you have up to 3 hours of battery life in each airpod. another feature that comes with the airpods is being able to customize certain things of the wireless earbuds to how you would like them. there are two ways you can customize them. the first one is by choosing what you'd like engraved on the case. the options of what you can engrave on them is limitless. some common things people engrave on them are their name, phone number in case they were to lose them, or a favorite quote. the other way you can customize them is by the name you want them under. when your airpods connect to your phone, it shows the name they are under on your phone screen and you can choose what you’d like that name to be. i love my 2nd generation apple airpods and i can’t say enough good things about them. if you are looking for a reliable wireless earbud, these are definitely for you.

i actually like these earbuds and feel that they fit comfortably in my ears. i have super small ear canals and the earbuds that fit in my ears never fit comfortably. i downloaded an app that enables me to get my calls and to hang up by tapping the earbuds (as if i had an iphone). i've been pleased with the sound quality and those who are on the other end of my calls have noted that the call quality is really good. battery life could be better but overall all this is a good purchase for sure!

i didn't know if these were worth the money considering that these seemed like glorified regular earbuds. i actually like these better. while the price is high, it seems worth it in my couple months of owning them. i got these for my first semester at college to ignore people and listen to bomb ass music without looking too broke. first off, these are pretty good with noise canceling. i can hear people sometimes if the music is low enough, but the sound is more muffled. it is great when i want to pay attention to my work or ignore people as they tune out people and they also make it a universal sign of "don't talk to me" which is great when i don't want to talk to others in public. even if i'm not listening to music! the other great thing is the fact that it's quick to charge and the battery life is pretty good!in comparison to regular earbuds or even headphones is the fact that they are easy to pack and easy to access. headphones are bulky and generally awkward (for me at least) to have around the neck. however, airpods are really easy to put in and then when you are done using them, you put them back in the small compact case. another is the lack of wire. i don't know about you, but for me the lack of wire is much easier. when i am in the mood to listen to something with my earbuds, i no longer need to un-knot the earbuds but simply take them out of the case. so like i said, i really like these and enjoy the easy access and the small compactness of this as well as the increase in sound quality and battery life. if i could rate this out of 10, i would give it an honest 10.

i got these as a gift from my daughters and could not be happier. the sound quality is great! i use them for phone hands free driving, multi tasking while on the phone, work calls etc. as well as for music. they sound great and the feedback from other callers is excellent as far as how i sound. i can hear the caller and my music perfectly and they have great dynamic range for music.  the noise cancellation issue is a trade off that i rated fairly at a 3 but that is not a negative. these fit loosely so that makes them extremely comfortable to wear and just about forget they're on for long periods of time. however, the fact that they are loose fitting does allow other noise to enter. this is a positive if you are in the car, have other people that may speak to you from time to time while you're wearing them etc. to me these are a great balance. i have another brand that i've had for years that fit really tightly and while they block out ambient noise they're also less comfortable and it's really hard to have them on while other people are around or you're needing to hear anything at all except the headphones. to me this is a great balance and i am extremely pleased with these!

real airpods are 5 stars, but amazon is filled with fake airpods, and the ones i received weren't obvious. i saw a review here of someone who had trouble with their new airpods, brought it in to apple for fixing, and the apple repair team concluded it was a high quality knockoff. turns out i'm a victim as well.it's like someone gutted a real pair of airpods, replaced the internals with cheap knockoffs and put it back together. everything with my "airpods" was identical and seemed brand new. plastic wrap was around the oem box (pretty easy to fake nowadays, but still impressive nontheless). everything was immaculate just like a new box of airpods, oem feeling cable, etc. the feel, touch, glue, placement of holes and patterns of the airpods seemed identical to my older airpods.1. the biggest clue was audio quality. the audio quality was considerably worse than regular airpods. it was noticeable right off the bat, especially when talking with other people. it was especially obvious since i still have my old gen 2 airpods to compare with.2. bluetooth was very unstable. leaving more then 6 feet away from my bluetooth adapter made it go haywire and produced a lot of static. it would also randomly go offsync with the left and right earbuds when listening with both of them on.3. battery life. they lasted about 2-3 hours before the battery died on them. not much else to say about this, just way lower battery life than new airpods should have.interesting thing to note, the apple limited warranty should not be used as a metric to see if it's legit. the first thing i checked was to see if these fake airpods had warranty, which it said i had 1 year starting from the day i paired it with my iphone 9/22/22. i thought this assured me that i had a legit pair of airpods. once i concluded the new airpods were fake, i did some testing and all i did was put my real old airpods with the new fake airpod charging case, and now my old airpods purchased in 2019 said i have 1 year of warranty starting on 9/22/22.conclusion: buyer beware, high effort airpods seem to plague amazon. if you want to save ~$25 bucks and roll the dice get these on amazon. if you don't want to take the risk of dealing with this headache, just buy it directly off apple.

i have always worn an earbud in my ear.  i am a working mom who is always on the go, always on the move, and always working.  i love to listen to music or audible while working, driving, house chores, etc., and because of this, you will always find one earbud in my ear at all times.  i've been a huge apple fan for years now, but i am getting tired of the dying of products after a year or so.i had a previous pair of airpods, and literally after one year of use (please keep in mind i wear these everyday), no one can hear me.  i can hear everything anyone says, but no one can hear me on either airpod.  my tapping to start and stop audio has failed in one pod also.  i assumed they were dirty, and had someone clean them, but no amount of cleaning would get the other person to hear me.  so on to #2 set of airpods.  again, a year later, same issue.  i can hear fine, but no one can hear me.  tapping to start and stop is starting to fail again also.i love my airpods, like the fit as i'm a small female, and these have never fallen out of my ears, and i can wear them all day in relative comfort.  but i'm over spending money on expensive earbuds that die a year later.i think i'm going to try the samsung earbuds this time around, and see if i can't get some lasting ability with those.

i ordered these on prime day from amazon. the pro was i received them within hours of ordering.the con, as with many name brand items on amazon i’m not sure why the quality you get on amazon is always so much different than what you get at actual large retailers but it’s always a different quality. one of the buds wouldn’t pair automatically nor did it make a sound letting me know it was connected. troubleshot the pod with amazon tech support and then it started working but the other went out. long story short, purchase from apple or target or maybe even walmart.as for the pods themselves, i would recommend getting the pro. these are cute and stylish and you can listen to music or videos or whatever but there is zero noise cancellation. like zero. i got them mainly for work so when i’m working i can tune out noise but absolutely no, i can hear everything around me. they fit well and the overall sound quality is good for what’s it’s worth but they are not the best by any means. they are convenient. i think the battery is pretty good. they stay in place. but if you’re looking for the best sound or noise cancelling, skip these. if you’re looking to save a little money but want a good quality bluetooth earbud set by a trusted brand then get these. don’t waste your money on the $20-40 no names cause they typically don’t fit well and have connectivity issues.

the sound quality is just fine. i like the ease of function by tapping. and i like how quickly they charge. only about 30 mins for another 4 to 5 hours use. but i have two main issues with these. i use mine at work all day. i have them in on average of 6 to 8 hours a day. i found that after that amount of usage, it wasn’t long before the hard plastic made my ears extremely sore. there were times i couldn’t use them because they hurt my ears too much. i realize i probably use them more than the average person. second, the mic stopped working just a few days after my warranty expired. that was a total bummer. i could no longer use them for voice calls. all that said, i do like apple products. i purchased the pros with extended warranty. hopefully i fare better with them.

overall, sound is fine. they’re just earbuds so i don’t expect audiophile levels of sound quality or any noise cancellation. but for an apple product, these things have far too many bugs for their price.these things are terrible outdoors or in very large spaces. they will cutout and disconnect, because i’m assuming the signal is too weak and doesn’t have anything to bounce off of. that makes them basically useless for the outdoors or in wide open spaces, like large atriums or gyms. i can really only expect to use these in the home or office, which meant i had to buy another pair of headphones that worked outdoors. it’s a bit ridiculous.speaking of home and office use, the mic does not work well at all, and is unusable for phone calls, video/zoom calls, etc. so again, i have to switch to a headset or my other pair of headphones for that, since people cannot hear me if i attempt to use these.on top of that, they also have issues with ear detection and randomly disconnecting from my iphone. i’ll be wearing them, listening to whatever, and suddenly they just drop the connection, as if i took them out of my ear. the only way to get it working again is to place it back into the case and take them out again and place them back in your ear. it’s very annoying and happens almost every time i use them.i’ve used two pairs since 2018, and both have had these issues. i’ve only used them with other apple products, multiple iphones and an ipad, so i know it’s not a device compatibility or bluetooth issue.my oldest pair has almost no battery life left, and is only useable for less than an hour at a time, so don’t expect these things to last more than a few years either.in conclusion, these have always felt like a step backward from a classic pair of wired earbuds. sure, they’re wireless, but it just feels so much less usable in so many different ways, while being 10 times the cost. apple needs to seriously step up their wireless earbuds game if they insist on moving away from wired connections and forcing us to use the garbage pods.

it has been quite a while since i've bought a set of apple earbuds to use as my primary form of listen-wear. i truly miss the design of the apple earbuds from the pre-2010 ipod days. i used the heck out of them as a kid, and thought the 2nd generation airpods would hopefully be the closest thing to that. for me, they aren't...sound quality is as good as i always thought the apple headphones were, nothing really lost there.battery life is fantastic, though admittedly, i haven't really charged them since i initially charged them when i first got them and it's been several days (not continuous use)...so...take that for what it's worth...comfort is the absolute biggest miss here. you have to shove these things down into your ear to get optimal hearing and my ears are not a fan of that. if you look up the external parts of the ear, the "helix crus" part of my outer ear is so irritated that once i take the airpods out, there's no way they are going back in. (so just leave them in then)....well...that's not always possible, and because they hurt so much, i find myself trying to adjust to make them more comfortable, and that just doesn't work.(so get some earbud cushions....) got 'em...i got a whole pack of 20 or so from amazon that people were adamant would make the airpods more comfortable based on their own experience......didn't work. you could say in some regard that they helped to some degree, but they definitely didn't take away the uncomfortability of the  airpods, and if it doesn't eliminate the comfort issue completely, they might as well not even be there...(could it just be your ears....?) yes, it absolutely could just be my ears. ears come in all different sizes and some may not even notice these things are in their ears - that's what i was hoping for...but sadly didn't achieve. perhaps if there was a smaller pair, the discomfort may not be such a problem, but obviously that's illogical.i also had an issue with getting the sound to play on them from my phone. bluetooth was enabled, airpods were showing as "connected", but the sound wouldn't switch from my phone speaker to the airpods. i can't remember what all i had to do in order to finagle that....but it took some doing, and no other non-apple product that i've ever used has had this issue...and if you research it, it sounds like it's a common issue with no real straight-forward resolution.it's truly a shame. i could have done with lesser quality sound and even poorer battery life in exchange for greater comfort. apple hits the mark on just about everything here except that one very important aspect, so buy at your own risk. i probably won't be using these the way that i thought i was going to be because of it...  $100 down...

i’ve been having connectivity issues with my airpods for about 4 months now and i contacted them 2 months ago, i worked with apple support from the beginning of me realizing it was an issue— all the way from restarting network settings to sending my airpods in. they obviously fixed the issue when i sent them in, as the issue went away once the airpods were returned to me. to my surprise they stopped working within a week or two so i contacted them… again. this time to no avail, “raiza” said it was my phone and asked for me to try connecting airpods to other devices, as they “never found faulty issues when the technician worked with my airpods to try to fix them” (why was this never even communicated with me anyways, til i contacted them? communication issues?) mind you, i don’t have other devices to try airpods with, but i do have a jbl speaker i always connect to my phone with, and i never have connectivity issues with it, so i know for a fact the issue isn’t my phone! apple support really has trust issues, and don’t take their customer’s concerns seriously or professional because it wouldn’t be the case that she kept insisting it was my phones network settings and was also told her boss would tell me the same thing. she then proceeded to end session as i was typing. i’m astounded at apple customer service. maybe it’s a sign apple needs to spend more time either training or paying their employers more. or charge their customers more for the warranty? next time, i’ll remember to keep getting my devices through t-mobile, they are much more helpful when it comes to warranty and have never had issues replacing my damaged apple devices throughout the 7 years with them; plus—no delays and no rhetorical questions! thank you for stealing my money, apple.

recently, i decided to switch to wireless earbuds because i keep getting tangled up when i go out for a walk. apple was the no-brainer choice, as apple earbuds have always fit fairly comfortably in my ears. i've always enjoyed that their basic headphones don't create a seal or have silicone coating on them as well.they synced up easily. they fit comfortably in my ears. they only have...one command per airpod? is that my fault for not reading it? yes. but it is also baffling that it's $129 for airpods when the wired ones that came free with my phone can pause, play, forward, backward, and adjust volume with one tiny little piece on the wire.so anyway, these worked exactly as they were supposed to and my purchase experience was pleasant. if you know exactly what you're getting, you'll be happy! i took away two stars because for this much, i could have just bought the knockoffs for $20. yes, that's on me. but also, the product could be much better.

let me start by saying our family buys lots of apple products. add that with the fact that having wireless earbuds are so convenient and apple appears to makes a slick product. the airpods fit fine for me and my spouse. the case is also very small, but the earbuds could have smaller stems. the sound quality is good, but not excellent. however, both sets we purchased had one earbud die within 1.5 years. i talked with a friend and they said the same thing happened to them. combine that with some negatives such as the high price, average battery life, the fact that these aren’t noise canceling, the annoyance that having a family sharing apple account combines all earbuds into everyones devices causing a lot of accidental switching of airplay, and you have a very expensive recurring cost per year per person. i thought about how a warranty might help, but you still have to pay for warranty plus the replacement parts and can only replace 2 parts. buying a new pair would have ended up being the same cost for us or even cheaper with the airpods on sale. maybe the gen 3’s will be more reliable but i’m not paying almost $200 to find out. my advice for most people, buy the off brands that come with an 18 month warranty and more features like double the battery life and controls. they will run as low as $30 and will probably be good enough. you can reward yourself with a music subscription using the money you’ll save.

these (2nd generation) airpods are amazing! they offer hours of fantastic sound and are a great way to listen to music and jump on a call anytime. the battery life is pretty solid, giving five hours of listen and talk time. when you place them into the case, they will automatically charge very fast allowing up to 24 hours of listening time without having to plug them in. the only downside is the terrible noise cancellation. it does not offer it as a feature in the product however the lack of noise cancellation is very noticeable. i have also had some issues connecting back to my phone each time but it is very easy to reconnect, so it's not much of a problem. overall, i would say this is a great product and would highly recommend it.

i got these for free directly from apple and that's the only reason i have them. i knew i'd never buy these -- just from the looks of the all hard plastic design i knew they would be a poor fit, especially being that there is no silicone tip to stay gripped in the ears and to provide a good seal for the best sound possible. what i feared is exactly what i experienced when i got to use these.it integrates nicely with other apple devices, and is also able to connect to non-apple devices as well. sound is good with initial ear-seating, but it quickly loses seal and starts to fall out -- this is when i'm just sitting still. what's the point of having great technology if it cannot be used? also, what's with the lightning port instead of the standard usb when apple has so much concern over plastic waste? side note : the whole trend of eliminating headphone jacks and forcing customers to purchase wireless headphones and/or accessories to use existing headphones already owned by customers fully contradicts apple's advertised concern for waste reduction. all it does is it increases apple's profit with our money and takes away our choices. also now you have copycats like samsung and others doing the same -- end of side note.i guess since it has apple's name, too many people blindly rate 5 stars no matter what. i'll give them 5/5 stars for their marketing strategies. the price is just plain funny but i guess that is the new normal. the airpod pros are the practical choice if one was deciding on only airpods, but at that price it's a bit too much considering other available options.

my little 7 year old nephew wanted the first generation airpod for his birthday but his parents thought they were a waste of money, so i got them for him behind his parents' backs and he loves them.they operated well until approximately a month ago. at that point, the right earbud microphone started to malfunction and would no longer detect sound until he yelled. i phoned apple customer service and went over all of the possible remedies, such as upgrading to the most recent ios and checking that the airpods were running the most recent firmware. when customer service was unable to remedy the issue, they advised me to send the airpods in for repair. i received a fedex shipment box and label and made them an offer for repair. the airpods were returned to me approximately three days later, along with a message from the technicians claiming that there was nothing wrong with them.i then tested them on my phone and my wife's phone, and the right microphone on both phones would only detect sound at a very high volume, but the sound was still garbled. i phoned apple's customer service department once more. the representative advised that i take the airpods to the local apple store and explain the problem to a professional there. unfortunately, the nearest apple store was an hour away from my house, however the agent did not appear to find this to be an issue.i expressed my unhappiness with having to drive 2 hours round trip to fix a $130 equipment, and i inquired as to why i couldn't send them back for repair while determining the specific problem. the agent agreed to send another shipping box and note that the problem was with the right microphone on the repair ticket. i got another package, sent the airpods in for repair a second time, and waited. they gave them back to me and said there was nothing wrong with them. and, once again, the right microphone isn't working properly.at this point, i'm left wondering why the "world's most valuable company" would consider it appropriate to force a client to spend 3 hours of my time repairing apple's product rather than just shipping a new pair and keeping the consumer satisfied. apple's customer service has tarnished what might have been a fantastic device.

warning to anyone purchasing here, i received previously used airpods. all factory seals were gone, there was some dirt on the charging case, and a little ear wax on the speakers. serves me right for not purchasing directly from apple.they may work fine, i don’t know. they were supposed to be a gift, and i couldn’t give them to someone in that condition. i have some second generation airpods that i’ve used for a few years now and i love them. no connectivity or charging issues, and really clear audio. i highly recommend the product, just be warned that if you purchase them here, you may get a previously used (and unclean) product.

i've owned these for a couple of months, pretty light use as i don't need to wear them all day or anything.  i've used them for music, podcasts, streaming media and they worked fine. the problem for me was during calls only,  terrible static is heard from the right earbud and for the person on the other end of the call, the static is so bad they generally just hang up because they can't hear me at all, just terrible static.  i went thru apple support, sent the airpods back and apple support said they couldn't reproduce the problem and sent them back to me.  i don't know what to do, i've got airpods that are unusable for calls, aren't anything special for music and other media and i'm out $120.

i am unsure who ears apple had in mind when creating these ear buds. i like to think i have average, regular ears but these headphones make me feel like perhaps my ears are too small. i have to adjust the ear piece every few seconds so much so i had to buy one of the ear attachment pieces sold here on amazon just so the headphones don't fall out which coincidentally has happened. watching my $160+ airpods fall to the ground nearly broke my heart. aside from that the sound quality is fine... i can feel the bass. i hate the fact that there's a button now instead of the tap, tap feature the air pod second generation has. so i have to deal with the ear piece constantly trying to fall out, being shorter than the sec gen and now i have work to find this miniature button on the ear piece just to skip songs. listen to me sounding spoiled.... i'm at a cross. i was "forced" to buy these because my 2nd gen was staticky and everyone complained. i thought perhaps these being the newer gen they'd be greater. oh well!! at least people can hear me now!!

overrated imo. sound quality is great, and obviously the novelty of how low profile they are is the best feature. however, the pairing technology/functionality is atrocious. forget about using them on a windows computer with bluetooth. jumbles and crosses wires with everything in the system. readjusts your mic settings, turns your volume up and down. total mess.and the worst part:randomly turns your volume to literal max on your phone when they automatically reconnect. can really f*** the rest of your day up and piss you off (at least for me).

even though i’m sure to keep my airpods clean, after a year, so much earwax has been jammed into the airpods that audio is significantly quieter. not worth the money. no noise cancellation which is pretty standard at the end of 2021. battery is great. the airpods last for a long time but the case starts to deplete faster as you use them. the microphone is horrible. if i had a dollar for everytime i was told i couldn’t be heard, i would probably have airpods pro’s anyway. i feel there are better options than these. if you want to spend some extra money, the airpods pro’s are a good choice. silicone tips (which would prevent the earwax issue), great noise cancellation, better microphones, recent. conclusion is, they’re great for about a year but unless you don’t produce earwax, they start to get quieter.

i bought these so i could listen to music while out on walks with my dog and zoom calls. after using them for a few months, i have some thoughts on this. i have a pair of over the head headphones that are noise cancelling. they were cheap relative to the air pods and they deliver great sounds when i play music on them. the airpods were only okay at 3x the price of the headphone. they don't fall out of my ear while walking or jogging as some people have reported, but if i go to tuck my hair behind my ear or rest my head on something, they fall out because of the long tail it has on them. the airpod pro looks like it would sit better in your ear and not get easily knocked out since it has a much shorter tail. all that said, i tried cheaper blue tooth ear pods and they were terrible and kept disconnecting from my phone so i gave this 3 stars because the sound is good enough for walks and stays connected to the bluetooth.  the battery life for using it for calls is pretty short (around 2 hours) but i've never run the battery out on them listening to music. the wireless charging case recharges them very fast and i consider that a huge plus. the airpod pro is likely much better but i'd still buy these over the airpod 2 just because of the huge price difference.

i've always wanted airpods but found the cost too expensive. i was really happy when i found these airpods for cheaper and i found the double tap feature really convenient when i'm on the go. unfortunately, i've experienced multiple issues with them.i often find the notification that my airpods are connected when they're in the case and the case is closed. i thought it was because i was using an older phone, but i just got the new iphone 13 and the issues persist. it's pretty annoying to have the notification because while it's at the top of my screen, i can't swipe down to access the notification bar, and it takes a while to go away. there was a time when i was playing music through the speaker and the music stopped because my phone said my airpods had connected.i've also had issues with the double tap feature. there are times when my music pauses by itself and though my hair sometimes brushes against, i just don't think it can mimic a double tap. there are also times when the headphones won't respond to a double tap.lastly, they die so quickly! i don't know if this is normal for all airpods but it feels like i'm constantly having to charge them, whereas my other bluetooth headphones can run for days on a single charge. i'm pretty bummed that these didn't work out.

i've been using some cheaper options, but decided to upgrade to the real deal. i've seen people using these in tv interviews and figured they must be the best.unfortunately, for my uses, which are mostly recorded video interviews via zoom, etc., the microphone was awful. versus a cheapo $30 lav mic, the mic on the buds sounded very muffled. no crispness on the high frequencies at all. worst of all, people could not hear me on the other end. the output volume for the mic was extremely low versus everything else i've used. i tried adjusting the audio settings in zoom and other programs, but still no good even at 100% volume.maybe it sounds great when used with iphone or an apple device (i don't know), but performance when paired with my windows 10 laptop was too poor for my uses. it paired fine and i could hear fine but the muffled, low-volume microphone was a deal breaker for me.

1 star because although they are amazing, i'm now on my 4th pair in 4 years.i bought my airpod 2nd gen directly from apple (not on amazon).  my first pair had the microphones go out, but i didn't realize it until just after the 12 month warranty expired.  i just thought siri sucked and couldn't figure out what i was asking.  had i realized it was a microphone issue in time, i would have been under warranty.  however, when i finally realized the microphones fully quit working, they wouldn't replace them (days past warranty).  soon after this the speakers on one side started going out.  i had to adjust the iphone sound settings to have less sound go to one ear so they balanced out and then up the volume.  at this point i decided i'd get a new pair because i use them all the time and need sound and microphones working.so, i bought a second pair.  fast forward several months and the microphones quit working on this pair.  this time i call for warranty asap.  they checked things over with me and replaced them.  to apple's credit, it was single day shipping and quick turnaround.so, onto my third pair.  about 3-4 months in with my third pair, the microphones quit working.  wth.  i am so careful with these things and have no clue how or why this could possibly be happening.  i was so busy working at the time i waited to contact support (thought the new pair would have typical 1 year functional warranty expectations).  well i was wrong there.  spent a long time with apple support and learned that the replacements are only covered for the remainder of your original pairs warranty (or 90 days if your previous pair were under that time remaining).  so, they only guarantee the replacements will function properly for the time remaining on your previous product warranty?  i get that they don't want people seeking a brand new product every year through minor warranty claims, but what if the replacement product legit fails in a short period of time?after being escalated to senior support staff at apple and some more discussions, they ultimately agreed to make an exception and provide me a warranty replacement pair.  sent them in and they confirmed the issue and replaced quickly.  again, quick turnaround with warranty shipping.so, onto my fourth pair.  everything works great, but it's only been a few days.i love the airpods.  they sound great.  i prefer earbuds that don't "plug" my ear and these fit my ears well.  only real issues have been those mentioned above.  another issue has been battery life.  it's great when they are newer.  normally, they notify you when they are running low several times before powering off.  as they get older, i'll get that low battery sound and then they immediately shut down.the airpods have amazing reviews and ratings by thousands, so i'm shocked i can't find anyone else having issues with microphones like i am.  they are great when they work, but i've had tough luck getting them to work correctly for more than a year.update on 4th pair... less than 3 months into the 4th pair and people were occasionally having trouble hearing me in conversations.  i isolated the left vs right mic in the settings and figured out the the right airpod microphone is going out (distant soft sound and cutting in and out).  didn't notice earlier because the left still works fine and it must autoselect that mic most of the time.  called apple and looks like i'm still in the 90 day warranty on replaced items (thankfully i caught it in time), so it looks like i may be able to get the right one replaced.  will have to again send the entire case and both airpods into their service center first to have them checked.i put these in my ears.  i put them back in the case.  i really don't understand how each pair could keep having this issue.
love them except they keep falling out of my ears. must be me. 😕

my wife purchased these for me as a gift in august 2020 and they worked great up until about a month ago.  at that time, the right ear bud microphone began to fail and would no longer detect sound unless i was yelling.  i contacted customer support at apple and worked through all of the potential resolutions such as updating to the newest ios (14.6) and confirming that the airpods were running the most recent firmware.  when customer support was not able to resolve the issue they suggested that i send the airpods in for repair.  i received a shipping box and label for fedex and sent them offer for repair.  the airpods arrived back at my home about 3 days later with a note from the technicians stating that there was nothing wrong with them.  i then tested them again on my phone and my wife's phone, and with both phones the right microphone would only detect sound at a loud volume (i.e. yelling) and yet still garbled.  again i contacted customer support at apple.  this time the agent suggested that the next step would be to take the airpods to the nearest apple store so that i could demonstrate the issue for a technician there.  unfortunately the nearest apple store is 2.5 hours from my home, though this did not seem to be an inconvenience in the eyes of the agent.  at this point, i stated that it did not make sense to drive 5 hours round-trip to repair a $130 device, and i questioned why i could not send them back for repair while identifying the exact issue.  the agent agreed to send another shipping box and to include on the repair "ticket" that the issue was with the right microphone.  so... (can you guess where this is going?) i received another box, sent the airpods a 2nd time for repair, and waited.  again, they returned them to me and stated that nothing was wrong with them.  and again, the right microphone still does not function correctly.  at this point i am left wondering why the "world's most valuable company" would find it acceptable to ask a customer to take 5 hours of his/her time to fix apple's product, instead of simply sending a replacement pair and keeping the customer happy.  apple's product support has ruined what could be a great product.

do not buy these unless you have an iphone.  there is no way to increase the volume above a library level of quiet, even turned all the way up.  i brought them to the gym and the waterbottle rattling in my elliptical machine's cupholder was louder than my music.  there was zero noise cancellation.  i tried every online "hack"  and workaround in the book and changed so many phone settings that i wound up turning my google pixel into a flashing strobe light screen which had to be factory reset (lost all my data.)  if you enjoy volume and have an android do not buy.  literally anything but these unless you plan to frequent places where you can hear a pin drop like the library.

this product has been nothing but trouble. first, the right earpiece is louder than the left, and there is no way to adjust this. at least i don't think there is: it came without any directions at all. a great deal of time on the internet found no solution.  there are no actual buttons, it is "touch" control, which means any time you adjust its position in your ear it turns itself off, or the volume changes, or it pauses whatever your listening to.  lately, the left earpiece turns itself off spontaneously, without being touched, after a few minutes. if you can manage to communicate that you want it turn back on, it will turn back on for - sometimes - up to an entire minute.  if the two earpieces become unsynced, the only way to get them both back is to stop what you're doing, place them back in the case, and remove them again. and no, they are fully charged.  it's not just that the device is fractious. it is designed poorly, since it is not obvious how to control it through various touch patterns and again, there were no directions included. (!!)  maybe i got a bad set, but my advice is to look elsewhere for a more utile design.

i received these headphones as a christmas gift from a relative. my first choice have not been apple airpods but beats. however, accepting a free gift is always fun. until you get fake apple headphones from a third party vendor on amazon.on the first connect, everything seemed fine. i sat them down for a second and went to use them again. my phone started freezing and glitching. when i attempted to turn my phone off bc my phone would not disconnect from them, i had an extremely hard time. i connected them to another device and they did the same thing.i went into the apple store here recently and discovered that the serial number on the box as listed in the photo have been reprinted on tons of apple made boxes by the third party host using “true” apple airpods serial numbers. they showed me the list.this is highly disappointing and discrediting to apple and also amazon.if you purchase anything with a name brand on it especially apple, please take your products to the main distributor to have them vip firm that you have made a legit purchase if you care about the quality of your product.no, i will not be removing my review. please handle this accordingly.

as most apple products are, these work pretty well. i know this isn't the case for everyone, but these fit in my ears perfectly and comfortably. i can wear them for hours at a time without noticing them. i've been using these with an android phone with some interesting results.things i love about them:- how quickly they connect. these things connect almost immediately once you open the lid for the case!- you can use either one on their own if you want, it doesn't matter which- the call quality is fantastic! i love taking calls on these things!- the range is pretty great. i can set my phone down and walk around nearby rooms most of the time without any issue.things i don't love:- the audio quality is alright. it's about the same as the wired earpods. not bad, but nothing amazing.- it's too easy to hear what's going on around me. they have no noise cancellation whatsoever. i could literally carry on full conversations with people while listening to these if i wanted.- connectivity issues. the range is usually good, but sometimes the connectivity is awful. i can walk around with my phone in my pocket and put my hand over my phone, and these will skip in and out. sometimes they'll even get out of sync a little bit. this has happened extensively. i made a warranty claim on them and apple said they couldn't find any problems so they sent them back, and i still have those issues. i also wonder how much this has to do with my phone though, because my phone (samsung galaxy s9) bluetooth doesn't seem the strongest sometimes.if you have an iphone, i'd recommend giving them a go. but i think there are definitely better deals out there.

i’ve tried a variety of earbuds, i finally broke down and bought the airpods but i don’t feel like they are worth it. i mean they’re fine, but they don’t work well for running... they don’t fall out but moisture (sweat) causes them to to disconnect because their sensors malfunction, i don’t know if that’s just me and it’s not like my ears are actually sweating inside it’s just sweat coming from my head. they don’t have the functions that other earbuds have (like tap for next/pause/volume) and the stress of worrying about losing them is overwhelming! they’re perfectly fine for walking and sitting and i often find that i forget i have them in because they’re relatively comfortable. but it’s easy to knock them out and if you lay down they can shift and “disconnect” again because the sensors aren’t touching your ear on both sides of the earbud. if you think you can use these earbuds and wear earmuffs at the same time (ear protection for loud machinery) think again! the lightest touch can knock one out then your audio stops and you’re left with an earbud in the earmuff. the noise cancellation is fine, i’m a female who generally only has one in at a time for safety reasons, and the sound is fine. i’ve had better sound from cheaper earbuds. im sure all of these things are unique to the user, maybe my ears are weirdly shaped, maybe i sweat more than most people. it just doesn’t feel like they’re worth the money. on a positive note, they’re great for phone calls.

i finally made the switch to airpods from my 2016 jabra elite 65t and it most certainly been a downgrade.  here are my reasons for feeling so:1. battery life is atrocious.  with daily use i would charge my jabra's once a week.  they had excellent battery life and the charge case was great with keeping them ready to go.  with my airpods i have to charge daily.  full being fully charged i took them on an hour bike ride and maybe used sporadically throughout the day and by night i had the warning of only having 5% battery, after being in the case.2.  sound quality is mediocre.  the jabra's fit in-ear and had an element of noise cancellation.  the airpods sit in your ear but have no noise cancellation.  aside from that, the my old jabra's had far superior sound.  there's not much else to say, they're just better than the airpods here.3. price.  i paid $150 for the 2nd gen airpods at best buy.  i think they're down to $128 now on amazon.  the newer model of jabra elite (the 75t) is currently $129 on jabra's website.  airpods are severely overpriced for what you get and i have the feeling if you looped in other competitors (bose, sony, sennheiser, klipsch) you would find similar results.overall the one pro i'll give the airpods is connectivity.  i own an iphone, ipod, and imac and the airpods connect very quickly to apple products.  i have been an apple user since the early 2000s so they've gotten their money out of me from brand loyalty but their quality has really dropped in recent years.  i think the only reason they continue to get glowing reviews is based on this loyalty to them.  i would strongly encourage anyone looking at these airpods to check out some of the competitors first.  you will find vastly superior earbuds for the same or lower price.  but on the other hand you won't be one of the cool kids with white buds hanging off your earlobes.

i bought the airpods new.  they work great for listing to music and phone calls.  however, about 9 months in the mic on both airpods have a defect where the caller can barly hear you, or voice recordings using the airpods is very low.  being out of warranty at 9 months the only option is customer paid replacement.  after checking the support pages, there are quite a few people reporting the same issue with airpods.  buying applecare for the airpods at $30 sounds good, but it cost $30 per incident for repair/replacements.  in this case it would cost $60 to get two replacement airpods.  $60 for the airpods and $30 for the applecare puts it at another $90 for a new pair, when a new pair costs $130.  even though the warrenty is for 3 years, it only covers 2 incidents....and replacing both for the mic issue is 2 incidence.  so the 3 year warranty endes at 9 months to get the mic fix...which allows for maybe 2 years of service.apple needs a recall program for this issue, because $130-$170 for airpods what will fail at 9 months is a problem.

i purchased airpods (gen2) for full price in april 2020 with the additional applecare protection plan. i am writing this in march 2021. around christmas time, these stopped working. because of the holiday season and having other earbuds i didn't bother going into an applestore to get them looked at.the apple employee told me that the serial number on the case is not the same as the serial number he is getting from the earbuds. that the case also does not feel like it is the same apple quality. the lid is lighter than what you find in the apple stores.i looked at my amazon invoice from my order history and found the serial number on that and plugged it into checkcoverage.apple.com. it was not listed. i plugged in the number on the bottom of my case, (it was different), this one came up and everything was expired.i feel horribly conned. looking at the amazon page it doesn't say you are buying from apple. but it sure looks like it. they worked fine for the time i used them but if they are not apple and the warranty is a scam, then why pay $125 something dollars for them. we are getting ripped off by fakes.
