airpods are definitely very convenient to use, especially if you like to listen to music or videos while you’re working/moving around. sound quality is standard and pretty much the same as the wired earbuds. the battery life is really good and you could listen for the entire day relatively uninterrupted if you use one airpod and swap when the battery runs low. even when i don’t use them for several days, the battery doesn’t drain so they can last a long while if you leave them around. however, there’s a frustrating issue that i’ve encountered more times than should be acceptable for rather highly priced earbuds. this is mostly relevant if you tend to only use one earbud at a time though; it’s not a major issue if you normally use both at the same time.the first pair i ordered came brand new and sealed, but within a few hours, they had already stopped working properly. the right airpod would not connect unless the left was also in use. troubleshooting guides suggested resetting the airpods, reconnecting, testing on other devices, and etc., but nothing fixed the issue, and it was consistent throughout multiple devices (iphone, ipad, pc). i ended up returning these and requesting a replacement.the second pair i received, which is the one i currently own, worked fine for the first couple weeks. however, the issue from the previous pair started occurring with these as well. i decided to keep these despite the problem because unlike the first set, these seemed to function properly at least sometimes, so they weren’t consistently dysfunctional. resetting the airpods also temporarily resolves the issue, but this isn’t the most convenient thing to do when it 1. happens rather frequently (pretty much daily) and 2. i have a case, and you need to hold onto the button on the back of the charging case to reset/reconnect. also, weirdly enough, this pair had the connection issues with both airpods. sometimes the right wouldn’t work without the left, and other times the left wouldn’t work without the right. it’s probably a weird coincidence, but it always seems like the one i want to use at any given moment is the earbud that doesn’t want to connect without the other.anyway, i kept the second pair because they were functioning well enough, and i had purchased them for $99 which i guess isn’t too awful for brand new and legitimate apple airpods. but if the price was higher and i knew about this connectivity issue, which seems to be rather common judging from all the troubleshooting forums i found, i probably wouldn’t make the purchase.

i really debated between these and the pro version but ultimately, i didn't feel i needed the adjustable fit or the full noise cancellation. i'm so happy with this purchase! the battery life is great (longer lasting than the pro version actually), charging is a breeze, small and compact so they go with me everywhere. i love them. i'm sure the wireless ones and the pro ones are really good, but these still hold their own in my opinion and are a great price for anyone who doesn't need the features of the pro version. i think wireless charging is kind of a gimmick anyway so i don't care about that in the least. i wish i'd bought them sooner.update: i’ve now been using these for 16-months and i took off one star because they don’t connect and switch seamlessly between my ipad and iphone, which is the main reason i purchased these over a different brand. also, they often don’t auto-connect to even one of them to start with. they are supposed to connect as soon as you put them in your ears to whichever of your devices is activated or whichever one you used last (you can adjust that in settings) but they don’t. i often have to go into the settings and manually connect them. they also often only connect in one ear - hugely annoying! i’ve had them randomly disconnect when on a phone call or watching something as well. they worked great for about six months but now i constantly have issues with them so i’m looking at purchasing another pair of wireless earbuds from a recognizable brand that is known for their sound quality. sorry, apple.

i found you on amazon prime day, waiting in the warehouse deals; you said you were "very good" and looking for a new beginning, but i now realize it was all lies because inside, you were a mess. i tried to listen to you with enthusiasm and joy but know now you were just a toy. after a few minutes or so, i sensed the "disconnect" between us as you would just shut down for no apparent reason, but i now know you came into my life with issues that were never disclosed. however, it was likely never to be, as we were not a suitable "fit" from the moment we encountered.  for one, i never felt "comfortable" with you, or did i appreciate you just "falling out" on me when i needed you to stay.  looking back, it appears all we did was waste each other's time, but i have to say life is genuinely better now since i got you packed and dropped off at kohl's.  i can only hope that you will make someone else happy and proud one day, but unfortunately, i only see pain, frustration, disappointment, and anger for anyone who gets involved with you. therefore, let's not forget honesty remains the best policy, and deception can never be the answer to unloading one's problems.

i had first generation airpods and they lasted almost two years.  i was planning to buy new pair but i wasn’t in the rush because they still worked, sound was decent and battery would last me 2-3 hours before i had to put them on the charger.  somehow i misplaced them so instead of looking for them, i decided to buy a pair on amazon.  they were cheaper than apple store so i thought i was getting good deal, not!  first of all, sound is really bad, there is static in the background and i’m hearing an echo of some unknown music (not what i’m listening).  last drop was battery life.  first time it happened i thought that my daughter might have used my airpods and drained my battery.  this time i fully charged them, charging station and airpods were 100% charged.  i placed them in my purse where they will be safe, and not borrowed by teenager.  they were sitting in my purse for 4-5 days, not being used at all so they should be fully charged.  well the light was green for a few seconds, then it changed to orange.  pods were not connecting to my phone even though i tried to connect them by holding button in the back of charging station.  i even tried to forget device on my phone, then reconnect, but at that point orange light on the charging station disappeared, and that happens only if they are completely drained, dead.  today they will be going back to amazon.  i don’t want another pair, i want full refund, and i’ll be buying a new pair from good old apple store.

i bought these to be able to run and listen to music without carrying a phone.  apple claims that their handoff feature allows airpods connected to the iphone to hand off a connection to an apple watch when you go beyond bluetooth range from the phone.  this never works.  you either have to take the phone along, or turn off the phone, then pair with the watch, and then leave.another problem is that after maybe 45-60 minutes, the music sometimes stalls and needs to be restarted, but invariably only one channel comes back (and sometimes neither one).  very annoying.  this tends to happen more in cooler weather, even with a hat on that covers the ears.beyond those two issues (which are enough to make me not recommend the air pods, at least if you plan to use them like i do), everything is ok.  sound is ok for non-noise-cancelling earphones; not great frequency response, but for this type of earphone you can't expect a lot.  they fit nicely and do not tend to fall out of the ear.  battery life is also pretty good, at least for my purposes; i can run for a couple of hours and change and they are still working (unless they don't, as described above, but that isn't the battery).  the apple watch runs out of juice before the earphones.

i really want to like them. they're supposed to be effortlessly convenient to pair and use for all your apple devices while sounding and looking good. but they're not....they're none of that. let me explain:sound - it's ok, really. no seal so you hear all the ambient noise around you which is good and bad depending on the situation. not much for bass extension, treble is flat but clear. adequate all things considered. if you've used the old design earpods, these are nearly the same sound profile. on a plus, the microphones are very good.features - very little to say here. they're bluetooth (5.0) so they pair quickly and have long range, when they work (more on that later).battery life - very good, a couple hours at high-ish volume on the pods and half a dozen charges per case charge. more than i need for most situations.functionality - 100% atrocious and i've had 3 sets of these (shame on me). the case and charging system is so faulty it leads to numerous other problems with pairing and connecting both airpods at the same time. the contact points in the case and on the pods where they charge easily loses connection, dirties, and later corrodes. using them for fitness around any sweat or moisture will speed up their inevitable failure. once this happens, one pod will refuse to charge or stay connected when put back in the case, draining it's battery or trying to reconnect to different devices when in the case. even if they didn't suffer constant bugs, the pairing with multiple devices is equally buggy, frequently losing connection or trying to connect to other devices in the house for no apparent reason.as far as i can tell, airpods pro share the same charging design, so i will listen to my own advice and stay far away from these until the design is fixed. i would advise you do the same.

at first these headphones were great. then the new wore off. i found that they were getting quieter and didn’t block out any ambient noise which for me was a huge turn off because i use music as an escape from the screaming of my family and shop environment. secondly about 5 months in the left side speaker blew. now for most people they wouldn’t be bothered but for me i’m kinda mad because i spent 150 dollars of my good money for this garbage that doesn’t sound good, and broke way before it’s duty was over. the fitment was also a big turn off, they would constantly fall out of my ears and were uncomfortable to wear. then the bane of their existence, the case would load up with so much metal filings that it wouldn’t be able to shut and charge the dang things. i’d have to clean it out with alcohol once a week just so they would charge. the only thing i liked about these was, how they looked, how they read texts to you, how they paired with your phone seamlessly and the sound they made when they hit the bottom of the garbage can. avoid at all costs!!! they’re a cheap headphone with premium features that’s why they’re so expensive.

it's becoming more well known that these types of headphones are considered "disposable" technology.  unfortunately none of us early adopters were made aware of this.  so just a heads up, expect standard airpods to last no more than 3 years before they're garbage.  i purchased mine in dec 2017 and they began showing battery issues in summer 2020 and by december 2020 they wouldn't stay on.  the left would cut out in 2-3mins (after being pulled from the case showing the earbud was at 100%) and the right would sometimes stay on for 10 or 15mins max.  again neither earbud showed as extremely low percentage even though they would both die way too soon.so if standard airpods are $159 from apple and they only last 2.5-3 years then to keep yourself using airpods it's going to cost around $50 a year for as long as you want them (to work).  this is good for apple, but not for the consumer.from what research shows, battery degradation is related to battery size.  therefore expect even worse performance and lifespan out of airpod pro's.

the best thing about these earbuds is how easy they are to use, specifically how they automatically connect to and switch between the devices you’re using.  can seamlessly switch from iphone to laptop to ipad.the shortcomings of these earbuds include:1.  although the tap controls are customizable, there are some key functions that are missing.  mute/unmute is the most obvious missing function.2. the sound is good, but far from great.3. the charging case is very slippery, making it very likely that it will slip out of your pocket.  i lost my first pair of these because the case slipped out of my gym shorts pocket when i sat down.

pros: i never experienced an issue with the sound not synchronizing between the left and right pods. they paired nicely with the iphone for what that's worth.cons: the sound quality was always poor to mediocre. they would were constantly falling out of my ear when exercising. one of the earbuds was consistently unable to charge, resulting in me having one charged earbud and one uncharged. recently, they have both started unpairing, making them unusable. the batteries also lasts about an hour at most, which is a fraction of how long they used to last when new. i could go on.on top of all of these technical issues, the apple replacement policy is not what it's cracked up to be. when i tried to replace them they would only agree to replace the airpod case instead of the actual earbuds, which i assume is where the faulty equipment exists, since replacing the case did not resolve the charging issue i mentioned above.i won't be buying these or the airpod pros because of this experience and i wouldn't recommend them. i have absolutely no clue how these have such a high rating.

buyer beware!  i ordered these apple airpods, which are sold by amazon and not a third party.  they arrived in perfect condition and sealed box. however, i called apple customer support and spoke with an apple representative to confirm they were true apple and not fake.  in order to confirm this i asked about the serial number on the box, then compared to the serial number on the charging case, right earbud, and left earbud. they have three different serial numbers!  that confirms the suspicion, these are not a matched set!  they have been tampered with and then resealed to make it look like a new product. at best these are used, seconds, or refurbished and mismatched when putting the set together. i am returning...don't pay this price for refurbished.  also notice the description does not disclose this. this is fraud.

so this is my second pair of airpods and i'm actually pretty disappointed in the overall quality. i don't see anything about them being refurbished but they certainly do not perform like my old airpods i got directly from apple. at first i thought i didn't think much of it because i've only had them for one month but these airpods static and click off regularly but the phone is still registering them as on and the videos/podcasts/music keeps playing but i can't hear anything. i have to take them off and put them in the case and take them back out for them to reconnect and i can hear just fine. worse when it happens on phone calls and fts because they're still connected with no sound. they do this several times a day. not only that, sometimes when i take them out of the case and they are supposed to "automatically connect," sometimes they do, sometimes they don't. sometimes only one does and the only thing that fixes it is me taking both of them in and out of the case several times. sometimes they're connected straight of of the case with no sound. unfortunately my return window closed about 11 days ago which infuriates me because i would like a replacement. again, i have just barely had these for a month. as a realtor and a mom, i need to have free hands. so disappointing and frustrating.

i own a pixel 2xl for personal but have an iphone 8 for business as does my wife. i ordered the air pods 1) because they were on sales and, 2) for business calls expecting high end quality as apple is known for. first, the quality build of the product is excellent. they connect easily to bluetooth and i must say i found the sound quality better than expected. however, the lack of a rubberized "ear piece" causes them to sit on the ear rather than in it. this diminishes noise cancellation. it also feels like they will fall out if i move around too much but admittedly, that is a personal preference and based on my ear "anatomy". what surprised me most (and disappointed) was the short battery life compared to other non-apple ear pods i have owned. the specs say 5-hours (which is short to begin with) but tests reviews i have read say 4.2 hours at best. not for me. i'm barely getting 3-hours. so for someone who is constantly on conference calls, i'm forced to switch back to the wired ear pods. and when one considers what apple charges $159.00 plus (when not on sale) for this and all its products, the value just isn't there. unless you are an apple fanatic, there are better wireless ear pods on the market that offer a better value.

it’s a pain to get apple service if you bought these through amazon and bumped into problems like i did.so i purchased these on prime day (10/13). as soon as 10/17 the left pod started having problems. it didn’t hold charge even was left overnight. called amazon support, was told to contact apple directly.long story short, apple first suggested to send me replacement for left pod and put a hold on my card of $73.83 for non-return fee (in case i didn’t return the defected airpod) — reasonable. then i received the new left pod, apple didn’t include the return label and just told me to discard the defected pod — which meant i just bought a brand new left pod and wtf!!!apple explained that since i didn’t buy these airpods directly from them, the limited warranty didn’t apply to my purchase. woaaaa!!!!amazon didn’t make airpods right folks?after a week of frustration calling apple to follow up (while using the defected pod, i didn’t wanna break the seal of the new pod unless i knew exactly how this issue gonna land), apple agreed to reserve the charge on my credit card for the stupid replacement.amazon associate was nice enough to follow up w me about this case. but the contract whatsoever between amazon and apple was a mess and their customers were the one who suffered.

i love these air pods.  price finally came down from the original price when they first came out so i went for them.  the last pair of head phones i owned was back when the wired version was around so it’s been a few years.  these sounds great.. love having no wires.  they stay in my ears no problem.  i didn’t want noise cancelling headphones so these are perfect.  i like them especially at the gym hearing what’s going on around me.  i feel almost unsafe with noise canceling headphones.. battery life is great.  i highly recommend buying theseupdate:the right airpod has been slowly going bad over the last couple weeks and now it’s always at 1% life when i open the up to pair them.  that’s with 100% charged case.  they’ll start charging when i open the case... great while they lasted.  used indoors only to.. disappointed especially for the price i expect better from apple

i want to like these.  they're easy to use, sound decent for music, and they work well for phone calls.  but apple's "one size fits all" scheme doesn't work for me.  i should have guessed these wouldn't fit me properly.  apple's wired earpods that come with every iphone tend to fall out of my ears easily.  why would the wireless version of the same thing be different?apple really should offer these in more than one size.on battery life, i was on the phone listening to music and/or the news at a reasonable volume for about an hour, then i was on the phone for about two more hours.  indicated battery charge went down from 100% to only 25%.  granted, it's a brand new device, so the batteries might not be quite "broken in" yet, but i don't find that impressive.i'd give these a more of a chance and a longer review, but since they simply don't fit right, they don't work for me. they're going back.

bought brand new. charged overnight. the left one works, the right one does not. apple did troubleshooting but were unable to fix. i was hesitant to purchase these given the poor battery longevity, then bought them on prime day. am returning (this was easy, although i had to drive to a kohl's to return them). i will not buy another pair.

i was excited to see that these airpods were part of amazon's prime special the other day. i already have a pair but the battery life doesn't quite make it through a full work day. i justified a 2nd pair to hold me over on a full days work.when i initially got the order i didn't notice anything odd about the packaging. it looked and felt authentic. after taking a careful look at the product, i noticed that the lid was not completely flush with the body on the back side of the charging case. i compared the apple air pods i already have to these and the weight and durability of the plastic seemed different but i couldn't tell for sure. after charging them all night the charge only showed 88%. that was the defining moment that i realized i purchased yet another dupe on amazon. don't waste your time and purchase directly from apple.

what an absolute waste of money.i got these airbuds because of their shape--it's about the only shape that fits in my ear and stays. i was also excited about the functionality of the earbuds. however, the earbuds were never fully functional. i  was never able to get the earbuds to switch through songs, for example. they did pause and play whatever i was listening to, but they most often did this when i would accidentally touch the earbuds. or my hair grazed the earbuds. so, really they were not very functional at all anyway. but i could use them to listen to music, and i'm really not super picky, so i just kept using them.about two months in, one of the earbuds fell onto a hardwood floor and broke open. i was able to kind of stick it back together, but it never worked after that. within days, the magnetic metal bottom of both earbuds fell off..at this point i contacted the seller and told them the issues. they said they would send a new pair. i waited weeks. still waiting, months after my purchase, for any kind of communication. i had to escalate my complaints through amazon, but the best they could do was refund half of the price.don't buy these.and if you really want to, at least don't buy these from this seller.

if i hadn't authenticated the serial number, i'd seriously think i was sold a counterfeit product.  since this is an authentic, new product, i'm just left to believe the product is mediocre at best.i regularly use my air pods on both ios and android devices. the air pods connect relatively quickly and easily to both, but especially with other apple devices. (for some reason, the max volume is significantly lower on my android device.) the bluetooth range is not great with reception starting to break up if you move more than 4-5' away from the phone.  the sound is pretty clear, but less than 10 weeks after purchase, individual ear buds will cut in and out or get static-y even while sitting stationary next to my phone.  like other reviewers, my individual ear buds don't seem to charge evenly with one often dying well before the second.  i've also been disappointed with the battery performance. the ear buds re-charge quickly when inserted into the case and i'd say i can probably get 5 hours of run time between charges of the *case*, but i struggle to regularly get more than 2 hours of run time per full charge of the ear buds (and oftentimes not even that).  finally, i have no idea how people wear these all the time as i found the shape of the air pods to be tremendously uncomfortable.  (though i am aware accessories exist to mitigate this issue)i truly don't understand the effuse praise heaped upon air pods. i am deeply underwhelmed.

i never liked the idea of apple getting rid of the headphone jack but never knew why.now i know. it wasn't to make space for more tech in the phone. it was to boost the sales of bluetooth headphones. and it worked. apple made a lot of money.i got mine and i really liked them. i also have 100 dollar wired earphones. i've had them both for about 3 years. the airpods no longer have a 4 hour battery. it has a 1 one hour battery per charge. i called apple to ask about getting a replacement. they said it was 70 bucks per airpod. i said, i might as well buy a new pair.that's when it hit me. apple is making money with the increase in sales for bluetooth headphones but also insuring that people will come back to buy more when the battery no longer holds a charge. they know this. i don't know about you, but if i pay over 100 dollars for some headphones. i want it to last more than 3 years. my wired earphones work like the day i bought them.this is diabolically evil of apple.i am telling you this as a warning. if you buy bluetooth headohones, be prepared to buy a new set in 2-3 years because the battery will inevitably die.

mixed feelings on this item.  i have a pair that i have had for about a year and a half that still work well.  i only use them a few times a week, but other than the fact that they constantly fall out of my ears, i like them.  if i wasn't able to find the aftermarket silicone ear hooks that i need to use to keep them from falling out all the time, i would have returned them and give them a 1 star rating.  to be fair, i have small ears.  so, i would consider another option if you have small ears.  that said, this review is for a second pair i bought as a gift.  unfortunately, after 6 months the right pod would not charge/work at all.  the left one would work, but only for about 20 min.  if fully charged and left in the charging case, both the case and the working pod would completely drain, which implies the batteries are not good in the case or the pod(s).  the person i bought these for didn't tell me about the problems until several months after she noticed it.  so, i had her give them to me and contacted apple.  support was really good and they tried to help me get them to work over the phone.  unfortunately, no luck.  so, i asked what my options were to get them replaced or fixed.  they said they were out of warrantee and it would cost over $200 +$12 s&h to get them repaired.  i paid under $150 for them, so naturally all i could say was thanks for the help...  i guess i'll just throw these in the trash.  there are a lot of options out there that are a lot less pricy.  so, i will replace the gift, since i don't like to give a gift that is defective.  however, i may look at the samsung or a couple of others that are out there.  again, the ones i own still work fine.  this pair was obviously just a "lemon", but since apple wasn't willing to do anything, i have a bad taste in my mouth.  pretty disappointed with apple.  such good service, but won't stand behind their products.  don't even get me started about the easy-break glass on their phones and pads.

i was using my airpods on a work call at the grocery store and the airpod case accidentally fell out of my pocket. i was unable to find it and when i contacted apple to replace the case, they informed me that i needed the serial number, which is written on the case, to replace the case. the serial number wasn't on the invoice from amazon and so unfortunately, i'll have to purchase an entire new set of headphones. frustrating experience. lesson: either make sure you don't lose the case or make sure you have the serial number saved someplace.

i was hesitant to purchase airpods because of the steep price so when i saw there was a deal a few months ago (early 2020) i hopped on the bandwagon! since i have many apple products, these do make it easier to sync up to my macbook, iphone and ipad. however, even with that being the case the airpods i received were defective. i spent hours talking to customer service and at the apple store (pre-covid) and they ended up having to replace the case and one of the airpods. at times i still have issues with connectivity and the microphone isn't the greatest. sometimes my airpods would be in the case and i wasn't trying to connect to my phone yet the music would play while they were in the case. i even reported this to the apple care team and my customer service representative told me it was something they'd never seen or heard about before. (seriously wish i was making this up, i just wanted to be able to have wireless earbuds).i'll admit that i don't fully regret my purchase, but regret buying it via amazon instead of from the apple store or a major retailer (i.e. best buy). not sure if my logic makes sense, but i feel like there would've have been less of a chance of getting a faulty item.tlr; airpods aren't a bad investment, but be wary and monitor your item if you buy it via amazon. also they aren't noise cancelling and the microphone isn't the greatest. the sound is ok but if you want to still spend a good amount of money, you probably can get better quality headphones elsewhere. the best feature to me is that it is super connected with my apple products and i can tap to change the songs, etc.

these ear pods are wonderful in quality of sound, ease of use.  i particularly like how you just lift it into your ear and it knows to switch.  i have not figured out how to answer and end a call without having to tap the phone, but haven’t looked it up.  tapping the airpod activates the music and switches the song, which is nice, but i have to find out if i can stop music play.downside:  battery life is surprisingly and disappointingly brief.  i used them for a phone call that lasted about 1 1/2 hours.  the buds went dead before the call was finished!ears are not one size fits all.  i must be careful when using them or they will fall out of my ear.  having to pay an additional $100 for the “pro" model, which is supposed to have adjustable fittings, is a rip off.  it’s like buying a pair of shoes, advertised at $100.  “oh, you want them in your size?  well, that will be an additional $100."  so, if purchasing these, beware of the fit.i will not recommend these or purchase again.

do not waste your money on buying these. they are passive, which means you hear everything around you so no matter how high you turn up the volume, you'll be able to hear everything around you.the microphone is terrible. on video call meetings i get complaints that the audio is fuzzy when i talk and that i sound like a robot. keep in mind these are paired to a brand new 2019 apple macbook pro, so there should be no issues, yet there are. if these can't work with a product that the same manufacturer produces i can only imagine how bad they are if you're on pc.battery life is also horrible, they die within a few hours of being charged and they get you with the gimmick that the case extends the battery life to over a day or something. dont fall for this marketing ploy. sad waste of ~$150. wish i had bought something else.

in order to determine whether or not these airpods were real, i immediately checked to see if the serial number matched apple's official website. the number couldn't be verified. after opening the box, i noticed two things: "the designed by apple in california" was black, not grey, and inside the case were small black particles. not only was it until i visited helpful websites that explain how to spot fake airpods that i knew these were fake. please don't be fooled by the packaging!of course, this does not mean that all airpods from amazon are fake. a friend of mine purchased them from here last year and hers was verifiable. so, i think it's a case-by-case situation. make sure to do some research once you receive the package!overall, i was looking so forward to finally purchasing my first airpods, but the end result was very dismaying and disappointing. although it would cost more, to play it safe, i would recommend purchasing from the official website!

overall i have really enjoyed my airpods but have only had them for a couple months. sound quality is pretty decent. noise cancellation isn’t noticeable but then again these are not designed for noise cancellation so i wasn’t really expecting that aspect. i gave noise cancellation 2 stars in case someone might be looking for that. battery life is as expected and there isn’t a complaint there. here’s my main complaint and i consider it a big one. for the first couple weeks i have really enjoyed the airpods and used them for hands free calling. within the last week people have started complaining they cannot hear me very well while speaking on the phone. i have tried adjusting the position of the buds in case the mic wasn’t close to my mouth and i have tried cleaning them but things haven’t improved. here’s the kick in the teeth...yesterday was the last day for me to return them through amazon. i’m currently waiting to speak with apple.

i'm fully in the apple ecosystem: iphone, ipad, mac. it was time to replace my wireless headphones and heard so much about the airpods and so many friends love them, decided to stay apple.  indeed airpods work great with apple products. if that's all you're going to use them for, don't hesitate. i've bought and returned 3 other airbud products. primary issue was the device staying in the ear, then sound quality.  airpods stay in your ears and the sound is very good for the price point.however........i'm primarily interested in wireless help with hearing especially my tvs.  i do not have apple tv. one tv is a smart samsung with bluetooth and the other is panasonic that i've added a bluetooth transmitter.  anything that's not apple has no issue pairing with the tvs.  when it comes to pairing the airpods, my blood pressure rises each time. sometimes they pair, sometimes not.  but that's not the real issue.  the airpods do not have independent sound control. if you're using an apple device, you control the sound through the device like phone, watch etc.  however, my tvs (two major brands) do not have volume control for output. very few tvs do.  so if the volume is too high or too low, i need to disconnect from the tv, pair with an apple device, get the volume where i think i want it, then disconnect, then re-pair with the tv and hope the volume is somewhere near where i like it.i spoke with apple about this and their response is buy an apple tv device. that way the airpod will pair and sound can be controlled. in my case, i would need to buy 2 apple tv devices.  the low priced airbuds come with volume control, apparently there isn't any technology magic required.  apple is choosing to not include.i'm still undecided about returning the airpods. the fit, comfort and sound are well worth the price. the volume annoyance is a reminder each time i use these things that apple is not the customer focused/design company we think they are.  before i bought the airpods, i spoke with 3 friends who use and highly recommend.  each one told me i would be able to control the volume with my iphone or ipad. after talking with apple, that is not the case.while on that subject, since my last apple purchase this is the first time in about 18 months that i've needed to talk with apple support.  what has happened over there?  four calls in two weeks; each time i feel like i'm speaking with someone that is just reading a script and doesn't really understand the issue.  the solution to most any issue seems to be, buy something else apple.  as a long time shareholder who's gone through a lot of stock splits, i appreciate the focus on apple products but come on, there's more solutions to improving an apple product than buying another apple product.

let me start this review by saying that i'm using these pods with a blackberry priv that has an android os, so take that fwiw.  maybe they aren't compatible, or optimally compatible, or whatever since they're an apple device.  i don't know, but the point of having them is to be able to listen to my phone without wires, and they don't allow that very well.the range is limited, like less than a few feet, and depending on where i'm using them it's less than that.  for example, i can be at the gym on an incline bench, set my phone on the floor next to me, and the podcast that i'm listening to cuts out. maybe there's interference from the gym's piped in music - they work well enough when they're about 10 inches away from me in the rack on the elliptical machine.this afternoon i was washing my car in my garage.  when i was washing the tires i left the phone on the hood of the car, and when i went to wash the rear tires, my podcast cut out.  i ended up turning them off them and using the speaker in the phone.the only time these pods really work is when i'm driving and i have my phone on my lap.  ymmv depending on how, when, and where you use them.

update: i've had these for six months and the case has stopped charging. they are essentially useless now. i would recommend purchasing through apple so you can get another pair if yours malfunctions. since i purchased on here and the return window is closed, i cannot get another pair, which means $130 down the drain.this was definitely one of my best amazon purchases. the sound quality on these is amazing even during phone calls. the charging case holds an impressive amount of charge so i only need to recharge it once every 2-3 days, which isn't very much considering i use these 8-10 hours a day.at work. that being said, there are some cons to these. the battery life of the airpods themselves isn't the best-- you'll get 1-2 hours max. now, five minutes in the charging case will get these back to full charge, so take that with a grain of salt. the biggest con for me has been the bluetooth connectivity. i have an iphone 11 so i would expect these to have no issues with connecting. however, every few times i use these, one or both of the airpods does not connect when i pull it out of the case. it usually takes about five minutes to figure out the problem and re-connect them. it's definitely a problem when i'm trying to pick up a call on my airpods or listen to something quickly. for that reason, i'd give these 4/5 stars. they're still worth the purchase but i'd recommend adding applecare so you can get a replacement if you have the same issues. (p.s. if you have an apple watch, these do not connect independently to the apple watch, you will need to have your iphone on you.)

i’ve had these since march 24th and to be perfectly honest, they’re not that great. they connect seamlessly to apple products and are quick to charge- that’s about it. they fall out of my ears constantly (which is annoying considering the original wired headphones that apple included with their phones fit perfectly- i had high hopes for these since the ear piece looks similar), they oftentimes won’t play whatever it is i’m listening to so i have to reconnect, and lastly, one ear bud seems to have a longer battery life than the other. so unless i received a defective pair, i wouldn’t bother with these. i’ll likely be sticking with my beats.

the loudness of calendar alerts is a deal-breaker.  it is maximum volume and seriously likely to damage your hearing and/or give you a heart attack.  when the alert goes off you claw at your skull to rip these out of your ears it is that bad.  i have thrown them across the room.this is a known bug with these.i researched this for days and the best i found was one method to adjust volume (kill all apps, reduce volume, use as normal( but as soon as you adjust the volume through a different app or on another set of bluetooth speakers, it goes back to maximum.there is no practical way to control this.if you use your airpods and phone for business and have a lot of calendar alerts, the airpods suck.on the positive side, the sound is pretty good.they also charge very rapidly in the case - very pleasantly surprised at that.  i get about 4 - 5 charges from the case's battery before that has to be recharged.the feature for checking the battery on your iphone by opening the case near the phone is also very cool.if they could fix the calendar bug they would be 5/5 rated.

my son talked me into buying airpods. they seemed kind of superfluous. an expensive and possibly of limited value item. but i liked the idea of getting a greater range of uses with my apple watch.now i don’t go anywhere without them. they sync with my watch in a few seconds. i now listen to more podcasts and have made numerous phone calls with great ease. i use them with my iphone when i want to listen to music without disturbing anyone. when i walk my dog, i use one pod so that i can walk her safely, and i find that to be quite satisfactory. the design is wonderful and functional. the case feels solid and is easy to carry in pants pockets. finally, the sound quality is outstanding, far exceeding my expectations. they’re not cheap, but you have to pay a little more for such an exemplary product. update: over time my opinion re this product has changed. i have found that airpods are painful to wear to more than a handful of minutes. they fall out of my ears with any vigorous  physical activity. additionally, the amount of time that they hold a charge is inferior to many earbuds that cost far less. because the sound quality is excellent, i still give it three stars.

we've been so tired of using clunky headphones or the terrible fall-out all the time  earbuds apple provides, that we thought we'd order the air pods.we have lots of apple products - an ipad, a macbook pro, and a couple i phones.we're not luddites, but we're not super computer savvy either - we don't program for instance.i was excited to give these a try.  if you can get them to work, the sound is beautiful and clear.  it was relatively easy to pair the pods to the iphones.  but, we still can't pair them to the ipad, and though we've had the ear pods for a week, we've only been able to pair them with the macbook pro one time.they come in a small package like a dental floss container.  as it turns out, there is a teeny tiny button to press on the back of the container.  it is well disguised.  they could have done something better so that your hand could feel the teeny tiny indent button, but i had to use a magnifying glass and strong light to discover it.  they should paint it with a red dot.  the only time i got the macbook pro to work, i had to get on my i phone and select the air pods there.some things to know:  when you're trying to pair, make sure your ear pods are in the case and that the case is well charged.  then open the case and press the invisible button. look inside the case and see if the inner tiny light has changed from green to flashing white.  if the case is flashing, place the case near the item you want to pair with.  make sure your iphone is de-selected and maybe your air pods will pair with your ipad or macbook pro.  maybe,doesn't it seem like a big company like apple could have made these more user friendly?we tried about 10 u tube videos trying to get these to work.
for some reason right ear bud does not work at all. iphone does not even recognize. left it charging for over a day still right ear bud does not work. left works great.

i feel like i got scammed! advertisement and the sale for the airpods 2nd gen is as follows: one pair wireless charging more expensive, they second pair cheaper and plug in. the way you choose your airpods from this seller is the same so it’s easy to come to the assumption that both are 2nd gen. so i feel like the labeling was on purpose to sale (obsolete merchandise) which cost me money and i ended up buying a product i didn’t want. i feel taken advantage of as a consumer i’ve never owned airpods because they’re pricey however being that my ipad and my iphone have different charging ports it’s hard to have just one pair of headphones for them i broke down and decided it was worth the convenience. its sellers like this one that made me want to buy directly from the website and as soon as amazon reopens it’s call center i plan to make a full complaint. please know what you’re buying be careful today sellers will take advantage of consumers with no sense of guilt after all it’s nothing but profit for them. i gave this product three stars because it is an apple product it was in new condition although it was not what i thought i purchased. don’t trust amazon to make sellers sell quality products, not everything you buy comes from them. the pair i current own work fine but i just paid 140 plus tax for first generation!!!! get me once shame on you!!!

i'm an apple fan and really wanted to like these!...quick take -- convenient, but uncomfortable, too quiet, only one control, and not water-resistantthe setup and automatic pairing make these really convenient to use. however, for the apple premium price, there are a few things that just come up way too short for me:- build quality is poor, leaving sharp edges where the plastic pieces meet. this gets really painful when you're taking them in and out throughout the day (i've tried 3 pairs, thinking i might have got a dud, and only 1 of the 6 pods had smooth edges).- the only control is double-tap. this is apple -- i'd expect a few more touch options. can't control volume.- way too quiet. it also seems obvious that pods that have no isolation or noise cancelling (for the sake of the design, which i understand) should have a lot of headroom for volume. not the case with these.- not even water resistant, which is really disappointing. i'm nervous walking with them if it's raining or snowing. we have the technology...
